topic.name: Theater Production & Technical Arts
topic.sub_subject_name: Art History, Aesthetic Philosophy & Christian Worldview
topic.description: 13-year academic progression (K-12) for Theater Production & Technical Arts in Fine Arts

objectives.objective_text: Identify the leader of the play.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Lighting Design (mood, color, cues, DMX basics)
objectives.objective_text: Identify bright lights and dark shadows.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Lighting Design (mood, color, cues, DMX basics)
objectives.objective_text: Name colors used for night (blue) or day (yellow).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Lighting Design (mood, color, cues, DMX basics)
objectives.objective_text: Identify a blackout.
Identify the people who move the set.
Name the 'Boss' backstage.
Identify the 'Call' (5 minutes to places).
Identify a king by his crown.
Name colors that fit a character.
Identify real objects vs. pretend objects.
Name a 'Prop' (property).
Identify sound effects (doorbell, thunder).
Name music that makes us feel scared or happy.
Identify the stage vs. the audience.
Name objects needed on stage (chair, table).
Identify the backdrop.
Recall that the Director helps us act.
Observe the Director watching.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Lighting Design (mood, color, cues, DMX basics)
objectives.objective_text: Recall that lights help us see the actors.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Lighting Design (mood, color, cues, DMX basics)
objectives.objective_text: Observe a spotlight.
Recall that we must be quiet backstage.
Observe the curtain opening and closing.
Recall that costumes tell us who people are.
Recall that we don't play with props offstage.
Observe face paint.
Recall that microphones make voices loud.
Observe silence.
Recall that the audience needs to see.
Tell a friend where to stand.
Summarize the Director's job (telling the story).
Explain 'Cheating out' (facing the audience).
Direct a short scene with puppets.
Explain how to give constructive notes.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Lighting Design (mood, color, cues, DMX basics)
objectives.objective_text: Summarize how light changes the mood.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Lighting Design (mood, color, cues, DMX basics)
objectives.objective_text: Explain what a 'Gel' is (color filter).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Lighting Design (mood, color, cues, DMX basics)
objectives.objective_text: Explain the difference between a Source 4 and a PAR can.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Lighting Design (mood, color, cues, DMX basics)
objectives.objective_text: Defend the psychological impact of lighting angles.
Summarize the job of the Stage Crew.
Explain why safety is important in the dark.
Explain the hierarchy of the production team.
Defend the authority of the Stage Manager during the run.
Dress up in costumes.
Summarize how clothes show a character's job or age.
Explain why we don't wear jeans in a play about 1800s.
Sketch a costume idea.
Explain the costume plot.
Defend the use of anachronism in conceptual design.
Summarize the difference between a hand prop and set dressing.
Explain why actors wear makeup (lights wash out faces).
Explain the Prop Table organization.
Defend the subtle use of contouring in makeup.
Summarize how music sets the scene.
Explain what a 'Sound Cue' is.
Explain the job of the Sound Board Operator.
Defend the use of silence as a dramatic tool.
Draw a picture of where the story happens.
Summarize the different stage types (Proscenium, Thrust, Arena).
Explain 'Stage Left' and 'Stage Right'.
Explain the concept of a 'unit set'.
Defend design choices based on the director's concept.
Compare watching a play with being in it.
Analyze the 'Concept' or 'Vision' for a show.
Interpret stage pictures (triangles, levels).
Connect blocking to character relationships.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Lighting Design (mood, color, cues, DMX basics)
objectives.objective_text: Compare warm light vs. cool light.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Lighting Design (mood, color, cues, DMX basics)
objectives.objective_text: Analyze the McCandless Method (45-degree angles).

objectives.sub_topic_name: Lighting Design (mood, color, cues, DMX basics)
objectives.objective_text: Interpret a lighting cue sheet.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Lighting Design (mood, color, cues, DMX basics)
objectives.objective_text: Connect intensity to focal point.
Apply basic stage makeup.
Compare the actor's job with the crew's job.
Analyze the role of the Assistant Stage Manager (ASM).
Interpret a scene shift diagram.
Connect headset communication to smooth transitions.
Compare fabric textures (fancy vs. rags).
Analyze the color palette of a show.
Interpret the silhouette of a time period.
Connect fabric choice to character status.
Defend casting choices based on chemistry and ability.
Analyze the durability needs of a prop.
Interpret Old Age makeup techniques.
Connect prop design to the time period.
Compare live sound vs. recorded sound.
Analyze the balance between dialogue and underscore.
Interpret the mood of a soundscape.
Connect mic placement to sound quality.
Analyze Sight Lines (what the audience can see).
Interpret a ground plan (bird's eye view).
Connect scale/proportion to realism.
Evaluate the pacing and rhythm of a production.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Lighting Design (mood, color, cues, DMX basics)
objectives.objective_text: Evaluate the use of gobos for texture.
Evaluate the efficiency of a scene change.
Evaluate the historical accuracy of a design.
Evaluate the safety of stage combat weaponry.
Evaluate the acoustic properties of the theater.
Evaluate the functionality of a design for actor movement.
Construct a directing plan for a one-act play.
Synthesize text analysis, design, and acting coaching.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Lighting Design (mood, color, cues, DMX basics)
objectives.objective_text: Construct a lighting plot for a production.
Create a simple prop.
Construct a Stage Manager's prompt book.
Synthesize leadership skills with technical knowledge.
Construct a costume piece or modify a garment.
Synthesize character psychology with textile arts.
Construct complex props using fabrication techniques.
Synthesize special effects makeup (cuts/bruises) with narrative.
Create sound effects using objects (Foley).
Construct a sound design using QLab or similar software.
Synthesize diegetic (in-world) and non-diegetic sound.
Create a shoebox diorama of a set.
Construct a scale model of a set design.

objectives.sub_topic_name: Lighting Design (mood, color, cues, DMX basics)
objectives.objective_text: Synthesize technical programming (DMX) with artistic vision.
Synthesize aesthetic style with engineering safety.
